Requirements: The organization defines and documents a process to inform users with a Privacy Notice for collecting and processing their personal data.
The organization timely notifies users about any changes to personal data processing.
The organization displays a cookie consent banner for users to accept or decline the cookie policy.
The organization obtains consent from data subjects for processing activities where consent is the legal basis.
The organization maintains records of consent given by data subjects.
The organization allows data subjects to withdraw their consent.
The organization collects user data after receiving their consent.
The organization collects data after obtaining verifiable parental consent for the processing of personal data of children below the legal age.
The organization has developed and maintains Personal Data Inventories for all processing activities.
Personal data attributes processed by the organization are minimized to what is required for fulfilling the stated purpose.
The organization has implemented a process for granting and removing users' access to personal data.
The organization identifies and defines timelines for retaining personal data as per legal and contractual requirements.
The organization ensures insights generated from personal data using third-party analytics engines are at an aggregated level.
The organization anonymizes and de-identifies personal data attributes wherever possible.
The organization has mechanisms to let data subjects access their data.
The organization allows data subjects to update their data and keep it accurate.

Control: Deletion, Restriction, Notification, Portability, Objection, Automated Decision-Making
Requirements: The organization allows data subjects to delete or restrict data processing, ensures portability, objection rights, and limits automated processing.
The organization documents responsibilities of privacy and security roles.
The organization maintains a data protection policy to ensure compliance with data protection laws.
The organization provides periodic training and awareness programs for employees on data protection and privacy requirements.
The organization conducts regular monitoring and reviews of its data protection measures and policies to ensure ongoing compliance and effectiveness.
The organization implements data protection principles in the design and operation of its systems and processes.
The organization ensures that, by default, only personal data necessary for each specific purpose of the processing is processed.
The organization appoints a representative in the EU for compliance with GDPR requirements when not established in the EU.
The organization ensures that contracts with data processors include clauses requiring the processor to comply with data protection regulations.
The organization executes Data Processing Agreements with all third parties that may have access to personal data processed by the application.
The organization integrates with third-party service providers in a manner that exposes only minimal requisite personal data attributes to these third parties.
The organization appoints a Data Protection Officer (DPO) to oversee GDPR compliance.
The organization ensures that the DPO's position and role are properly defined and communicated.
The organization ensures that the DPO operates independently and reports directly to the highest management level.
The organization provides adequate resources, training, and support for the DPO to carry out their tasks effectively.
The organization ensures that the DPO has the necessary expertise/professional competence in data protection law and practices.
The organization maintains records of processing activities (ROPA), including the purposes of processing, categories of data subjects and personal data, and recipients of personal data.
The organization cooperates with data protection authorities in the performance of their tasks, providing necessary information and access to data processing activities.
The organization restricts access to personal data processed only to authorized personnel.
The organization releases security updates in a timely manner, upon identification of vulnerabilities, bugs, or security enhancements.
The organization backs up critical data on a periodic basis.
The organization enables audit logging on all systems and ensures the same can be extracted for all Products.
The organization has implemented a Web Application firewall to protect the product from malicious attacks.
The organization protects personal data stored with a secure level of encryption.
The organization protects all client-server communications with an appropriate level of encryption.
The organization subjects systems to periodic Vulnerability Assessments and patches critical vulnerabilities without undue delay.
The organization protects backend integrations using secure APIs/Web services.
The organization notifies customers of a personal data breach within 48 hours unless the breach is unlikely to result in a risk to rights and freedoms.
The organization communicates a breach to data subjects without undue delay when it likely results in a high risk to their rights and freedoms.
The organization ensures changes to processing personal data are subject to prior approval before development.
The organization addresses and mitigates risks identified in Privacy Assessments in a timely manner.
The organization ensures development, test, and production environments are segregated and access to production is restricted.
The organization tests only in test environments and does not use production data for testing.
The organization performs DPIAs periodically and addresses medium and high risks in a timely manner.
The organization consults supervisory authority before processing if DPIA indicates high risk without mitigation.
The organization makes the DPO easily accessible to data subjects and authorities.
The organization ensures data transferred outside the EU is protected by appropriate safeguards.
The organization transfers personal data only to jurisdictions with adequate levels of protection.
The organization adheres to approved codes of conduct and certifications to demonstrate GDPR compliance when transferring data.
